Definition.name: Directing
Definition.description: Tell others what to do

Definition.name: Facilitating
Definition.description: Coordinate the input of others

Definition.name: Coaching
Definition.description: Help others achieve their goals

Definition.name: Supporting
Definition.description: Provide assistance along the way

Definition.name: Autocratic
Definition.description: Everyone does what the manager wants them to do

Definition.name: Consultative
Definition.description: Obtain others' oppinions and act as the servant-leader for the team.

Definition.name: Consultative-Autocratic
Definition.description: Solicit input from team members, but retain decision-making authority for him- or herself.

Definition.name: Consensus
Definition.description: Problem solving in a group, decisions are made based on group agreements.

Definition.name: Delegating
Definition.description: Establish goals and give the team sufficient authority to complete the work.

Definition.name: Bureaucratic
Definition.description: Follow procedures exactly.

Definition.name: Charismatic
Definition.description: Energize and encourage the team in performing project work.

Definition.name: Democratic or Participative
Definition.description: Encourage team in the decision-making process.

Definition.name: Laissez-faire
Definition.description: Allow to act, allow to do, leave alone.

Definition.name: Analytical
Definition.description: Depend on technical know-how and ability.

Definition.name: Driver
Definition.description: Constantly give directions.

Definition.name: Influencing
Definition.description: Emphasize teamwork, team building and team decision making.

Definition.name: No. 2 Conflict Reason
Definition.description: Project Priorities

Definition.name: No. 4 Conflict Reason
Definition.description: Technical opinions

Definition.name: No. 5 Conflict Reason
Definition.description: Administrative procedures

Definition.name: Collaborating
Definition.description: Problem solving

Definition.name: Collaborating
Definition.description: The parties openly discuss differences and try to incorporate multiple viewpoints in order to lead to consensus. This leads to a win-win situation.

Definition.name: Compromising
Definition.description: Finding solutions and bring some degree of satisfaction to both parties.

Definition.name: Withdrawal
Definition.description: Retreat or postpone a decision on a problem.

Definition.name: Smoothing
Definition.description: Emphasize agreement rather than differences of options

Definition.name: Forcing
Definition.description: Push one viewpoint at the expense of another.

Definition.name: Withdrawal
Definition.description: Not usually the best, but sometimes necessary

Definition.name: Forming
Definition.description: People are brought together as a team.

Definition.name: Storming
Definition.description: There are disagreements as people learn to work together.

Definition.name: Norming
Definition.description: Team members begin to build good working relationships.

Definition.name: Performing
Definition.description: The team becomes efficient and works effectively together.

Definition.name: Adjourning
Definition.description: The project ends, and the team is disbanded.

Definition.name: Expectancy Theory
Definition.description: Employees who believe their efforts will lead to effective performance and who expect to be rewarded for their accomplishments will remain productive as rewards meet their expectations.

Definition.name: Arbitration
Definition.description: A neutral party hears and resolves a dispute.

Definition.name: Perquisites (Perks)
Definition.description: Some employees receive special rewards, such as assigned parking spaces, corner offices, and executive dining.

Definition.name: Fringe Benefits
Definition.description: These are the "standard" benefits formally given to all employees, such as education benefits, insurance, and profit sharing.

Process.name: Determine Company Culture and Existing Systems
Collect Processes, procedures, and historical information
Uncover initial requirements, assumptions, risks, constaints and existing agreements
Assess project and product feasibility within the given constraints
Identify Stakeholders and determine their expectations, influence and impact
Determine how you will plan for each knowledge area
Assess what to purchase and create procurement documents
Determine quality standards, processes, and metrics
Perform risk identification, qualtitative risk analysis, and risk response planning
Finalize the "how to execute and control" part of all management plans
Develop realistic and final PM plan and performance measurement baseline
Gain formal approval of the plan
Execute the work according to the PM plan
Determine whether processes are correct and effective (quality assurance)
Release resources as work is completed
Send and receive information, and solicit feedback
Take action to control the project
Measure performance against the performance measurement baseline
Measure performance against the other metrics in the PM plan
Determine if variances warrant a corrective action or other change request
Influence the factors that cause changes
Update the PM plan and project documents
Inform stakeholders of the results of change requests
Gain acceptance of interim deliverables from the customer
Confirm work is done to requirements
Gain final acceptance of the product
Solicit feedback from the customer about the project
Gather final lessons learned and update knowledge base
